data.question: What is the overall yield of the enantiopure Schiff base ligand (MOM)2L(cid:2)2 H synthesized from 5,5’,6,6’-tetramethyl-2,2’-diol-1,1’-biphenyl?
At what temperature and for how long was the mixture containing CuSO4·5H2O and (MOM)2L(cid:2)2 H heated to synthesize complex 1?
What are the BET surface areas of complexes 2 and 3, and how do they compare to their theoretical values?
data.answer: Complex 2 has a BET surface area of 375.1 m2 g(cid:2)1 and complex 3 has 421.4 m2 g(cid:2)1, both are smaller than their theoretical values of 1570.0 and 1084.0 m2 g(cid:2)1 respectively

data.question: What role does temperature play in the formation of different clusters, cages, and frameworks in the synthesis of MOFs?
data.answer: Temperature controls the assembly process, with higher temperatures expected to afford more thermodynamically stable and denser crystal forms

data.question: How does the synthesis of MOFs from a helicate differ from traditional MOF synthesis methods?
data.answer: The synthesis from a helicate represents a stepwise construction of MOFs using a helicate as a building block, unlike traditional methods that often involve a one-pot procedure

data.question: Is the helical structure and optical activity of complex 1 maintained when assembling into frameworks in solution?
The synthesis of mesoporous MOFs is challenging due to their tendency to reduce porosity through interpenetration. Does this apply to complexes 2 and 3?
data.answer: False, complexes 2 and 3 maintain their structural integrity and open channels in solution, indicating they overcome this challenge

data.question: Are complexes 2 and 3 capable of adsorbing Rhodamin 6G and Brilliant Blue R-250 molecules?
Does the synthesis of complex 1 involve the use of DMSO as a solvent?
Is the crystal structure of complex 1 determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction?
Do complexes 2 and 3 exhibit type I sorption behavior?
data.answer: False, complex 1 exhibits type I sorption behavior, while complexes 2 and 3 exhibit type IV sorption behaviors

data.question: Are the solid-state CD spectra of complexes 1-3 mirror images of each other when made from R and S enantiomers of L?
What is the role of the pyridyl-functionalized Schiff base units in the synthesis of the helicate-based ligands?
data.answer: They chelate metal ions to form linear helicates and allow the entrapment of more metal ions into the helical cavity, leading to a cluster structure

data.question: How does the presence of C2-symmetrical 1,1’-biphenol derivatives contribute to the creation of helical species?
data.answer: They serve as excellent platforms for creating helical species by forming helicate-based ligands with tetraanionic hexadentate ligand bearing two pyridine-functionalized Schiff base units

data.question: What is the significance of the D3 symmetry in the Cu7 helicate precursors for the formation of complexes 2 and 3?
data.answer: The D3 symmetry of the Cu7 helicate precursors is amplified in the infinite frameworks of complexes 2 and 3, maintaining the same handedness of chirality and D3 symmetry

data.question: What experimental technique was used to confirm the permanent porosities of complexes 1-3?
data.answer: Their permanent porosities were confirmed by their N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K and by liquid-phase adsorptions

data.question: What is the significance of the strong CH···p interactions in the structure of complex 1?
data.answer: They direct the packing of helicates along the c axis, forming a nanosized tubule with an opening of 1.2 (cid:3) 1.1 nm

data.question: How does the synthesis of complex 2 differ from that of complex 3 in terms of temperature and product stability?
data.answer: Complex 2 is synthesized at 80 8C and complex 3 at 100 8C, with both complexes being stable in air and insoluble in water and organic solvents

data.question: What is the role of tert-butyl groups in the supramolecular structure of complex 1?
data.answer: They participate in hydrophobic interactions with adjacent helicates, reinforcing the 3D nanotubular architecture

data.question: Is the synthesis of MOFs with mesoporosity and large open channels a common achievement according to the text?
data.answer: False, the synthesis of MOFs with mesoporosity remains a great challenge, making complexes 2 and 3 notable exceptions
